keyword: how many calories in a chocolate donut
title: How Many Calories in a Chocolate Donut?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a chocolate donut, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Chocolate Donut?
assumptions: Standard yeast-raised chocolate glazed donut, ~60 g, from a typical bakery; includes chocolate icing but no fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, recipe, and preparation; fried vs. baked affects values. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard chocolate donut contains about 250 calories and 14 g of fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a chocolate donut from Dunkin'?
faqs.a: Around 250-300 kcal depending on size; check their app for exact values.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a chocolate donut?
faqs.a: Typically 30 g carbs, including 15 g sugars and 1 g fiber per donut.

faqs.q: Is a chocolate donut high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, about 14 g total fat with 6 g saturated per standard donut.

faqs.q: How does baking change calories in a chocolate donut?
faqs.a: Baked versions can reduce calories by 50-100 vs. fried, lowering fat content.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a chocolate donut?
faqs.a: Low at about 3 g per donut; not a significant protein source.
